channel.title: Are you leading a sedentary or an active lifestyle?
channel.description: Sedentary lifestyle is a term used to describe a lifestyle that involves little or no physical activity. A person who lives a sedentary lifestyle is known as a couch potato. They spend their time watching TV, playing video games, or playing or working on the computer. There are many health risks associated with a sedentary lifestyle – premature death, disease/illness, mental illness, chronic diseases, unintentional injuries, etc.

item.title: Are you leading a sedentary or an active lifestyle?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:39, topic:405800”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=502791.msg3682571#msg3682571 date=1311631448]
You don’t know how much you can bench or something else that I missed completely?

How often do you have practice and how long? I mean, if your practicing every day for like 2 hours a day then go home and do absolutely nothing that is what Health classifies as an active lifestyle.
[/quote]
@First: Nevermind

@Second: Well, I play soccer five days a week for two hours a day, does that count?[/quote]

Yeah that counts.

@krackkid, they have great benefits and makes good money. Good luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Are you leading a sedentary or an active lifestyle?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:37, topic:405800”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=502791.msg3682432#msg3682432 date=1311626998]

3.9% body fat, and 80% of the day I don’t move from my computer chair. The other 20% is sports or eating.
Everything you learn in health classes is a lie, because they don’t include the ‘exceptions’ (which seem to occur quite often).

Don’t really know anyone who is an exception. I know kids that are skinny and all they do is play video games but just because your skinny doesn’t mean your healthy. Most kids have no muscle because they don’t use them.
[/quote]

I would be an asshole and say, “I can bench (Insert random made-up amount here)”- but I won’t, because I honestly don’t know.
I do know that I am an exception, and sports made me strong (even though I’m lazy when I’m not playing sports).[/quote]

You don’t know how much you can bench or something else that I missed completely?

How often do you have practice and how long? I mean, if your practicing every day for like 2 hours a day then go home and do absolutely nothing that is what Health classifies as an active lifestyle.

Read full topic
item.source: Are you leading a sedentary or an active lifestyle?

item.title: Are you leading a sedentary or an active lifestyle?
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:36, topic:405800”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=502791.msg3682392#msg3682392 date=1311624852]
3.9% body fat, and 80% of the day I don’t move from my computer chair. The other 20% is sports or eating.
Everything you learn in health classes is a lie, because they don’t include the ‘exceptions’ (which seem to occur quite often).
[/quote]

Don’t really know anyone who is an exception. I know kids that are skinny and all they do is play video games but just because your skinny doesn’t mean your healthy. Most kids have no muscle because they don’t use them.[/quote]

I would be an asshole and say, “I can bench (Insert random made-up amount here)”- but I won’t, because I honestly don’t know.
I do know that I am an exception, and sports made me strong (even though I’m lazy when I’m not playing sports).

Read full topic

item.title: Are you leading a sedentary or an active lifestyle?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote="`Alec, post:3, topic:405805"]I believe that I used to be very lazy and inactive. I played video games all of my day and started the next one at around 2pm. When I wasn’t gaming I was programming or on this site. However, since then I have gotten a job, started playing golf, gotten back into soccer, and have barely visited this site.

I consider myself very active.[/quote]

I haven’t seen you on Facebook recently. :[ It seems that you got a life now? Well that’s good. I still feel like I’m breaking even.

Read full topic
